metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29970 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A malicious webpage could have triggered a use-after-free, memory corruption, and a potentially exploitable crash. *This bug could only be triggered when accessibility was enabled.*. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.12, Firefox ESR < 78.12, and Firefox < 90.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
